content.question: A circuit is constructed with the battery, switch, two identical resistors, and the inductor shown in the diagram. Let <math alttext="I sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the current in the middle branch and <math alttext="I sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> the current in the branch with the inductor. The currents are in the directions shown. Which of the following pairs of equations accurately represents the potential differences for two loops in the circuit shown above?

choices.label: Equation 1Equation 2<math alttext="0 equals, epsilon minus I sub 1, times R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>=</mo><mi>ε</mi><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mi>R</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math><math alttext="0 equals, epsilon minus I sub 2, times R, minus, L times the derivative of I sub 2 with respect to t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>=</mo><mi>ε</mi><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mi>R</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>L</mi><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><msub><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="0 equals, epsilon plus I sub 1, times R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>=</mo><mi>ε</mi><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mi>R</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math><math alttext="0 equals, epsilon minus I sub 2, times R, minus, L times the derivative of I sub 2 with respect to t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>=</mo><mi>ε</mi><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mi>R</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>L</mi><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><msub><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="0 equals, epsilon minus I sub 1, times R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>=</mo><mi>ε</mi><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mi>R</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math><math alttext="0 equals, epsilon minus I sub 2, times R, plus, L times the derivative of I sub 2 with respect to t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>=</mo><mi>ε</mi><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mi>R</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>L</mi><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><msub><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="0 equals, epsilon plus I sub 1, times R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>=</mo><mi>ε</mi><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mi>R</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math><math alttext="0 equals, epsilon minus I sub 2, times R, plus, L times the derivative of I sub 2 with respect to t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>=</mo><mi>ε</mi><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mi>R</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>L</mi><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><msub><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="0 equals, epsilon minus I sub 1, times R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>=</mo><mi>ε</mi><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mi>R</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math><math alttext="0 equals, epsilon minus I sub 1, times R, minus, L times the derivative of I sub 2 with respect to t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>=</mo><mi>ε</mi><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mi>R</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>L</mi><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><msub><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: Equation 1Equation 2<math alttext="0 equals, epsilon minus I sub 1, times R" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>=</mo><mi>ε</mi><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub><mi>R</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math><math alttext="0 equals, epsilon minus I sub 2, times R, minus, L times the derivative of I sub 2 with respect to t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn><mo>=</mo><mi>ε</mi><mo>−</mo><msub><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mi>R</mi><mo>−</mo><mi>L</mi><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><msub><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
